SALESFORCE HELP
DOCS
VISUALFORCE B2B COMMERCE RELEASE NOTES AND UPGRADE GUIDE
Populate Search Autocomplete Suggestions More Quickly

Deliver a better experience to your buyers when they begin typing in a storefront search field and see a list of suggested results. When you use the Product List page version 2.0, B2B Commerce for Visualforce now returns autocomplete suggestions with a SOSL query of your product index records. With this change, search autocomplete and the Product List page can reference the same data source, which results in fewer database queries for your storefront.

Where: This change applies to B2B Commerce for Visualforce Summer ’19 (version 4.11) in Lightning Experience and Salesforce Classic in Enterprise, Performance, Unlimited, and Developer editions.

Who: This change only applies to storefronts using the Product List page version 2.0.

Why: Previous versions of B2B Commerce for Visualforce returned search autocomplete results by executing a SOQL query of your product data. This design could negatively affect performance because it searched multiple database tables.

How: After you upgrade the managed package, this change is available automatically if you've enabled the Product List page version 2.0.

If the Product List page version 1.0 is enabled, autocomplete still uses a SOQL query of your product data.

If you previously extended the ccrz.cc_hk_Catalog class to override the default SOQL query for populating autocomplete suggestions, this change doesn't conflict with that customization. Evaluate performance of the new implementation and determine whether it can meet your needs.

SEE ALSO
Considerations for Autocomplete Suggestions in Search Box and Quick Order Widgets
